definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: It was a creed written into the founding documents that declared the destiny of a nation.
sentences.chinese: 这是载于我们的建国宪章的基本信念。

sentences.english: So we can think about a belief together, agreeing or disagreeing.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们可以一起来思考某个信念，同意或者不同意。

sentences.english: They were simply the physical manifestations of your belief in peoples’ evil nature.
sentences.chinese: 这就是你信念中关于人类邪恶本质的物理表现。

sentences.english: Zhang Xiaoxiao also strengthened the conviction stick.
sentences.chinese: 也坚定了张筱筱坚持下去的信念。

sentences.english: He had a strong belief: Treat people sincerely.
sentences.chinese: 他有着自己的信念并永远真诚待人。

sentences.english: So you are as though attracting facts that further deepen your negative beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 所以你好像在一直吸引坏的事情来加深你的负面信念。

sentences.english: I find my solace in faith.
sentences.chinese: 我找到了我信念的慰籍。

sentences.english: What are the destructive habits, behaviours and beliefs I need to address?
sentences.chinese: 我还需要处理怎样的有害习惯，行为和信念呢？

sentences.english: Dr. Howard will be even greater strength and greater faith in the fruits of harvest.
sentences.chinese: 华博士将以更大的实力和信念收获更大的果实。

sentences.english: Our evident fence near the residence is our confidence of correspondent defence.
sentences.chinese: 我们住宅周围彰彰的栅栏是我们相应防卫的信念。

sentences.english: Conviction of preacher passes into truth of hearers .
sentences.chinese: 讲道者的信念，使听者扎心知罪，认识真理。

sentences.english: He placed the incipience of democratic faith at around 1850.
sentences.chinese: 他认为民主主义信念从大约1850年起开始出现。

sentences.english: Its defect consists in that the categories serving as the foundations are too absolutized.
sentences.chinese: 其缺陷则在于作为基础信念的范畴过于绝对化。

sentences.english: I choose beliefs that bring me aliveness and growth.
sentences.chinese: 我选择带给我活力与成长的信念。

sentences.english: Yet there are signs the belief in US invincibility is waning.
sentences.chinese: 但有迹象显示，“美国无敌”的信念正在不断削弱。

sentences.english: Have faith, Mr. Reagan asked his party and his country.
sentences.chinese: 里根对他的政党和国家的要求是坚守信念。

definition: to be strongly attached to/to be dedicated/to cling to
(one's) original intention, aspiration etc/(Buddhism) "beginner's mind" (i.e. having an attitude of openness when studying a subject just as a beginner in that subject would)
to hold fast to/to stick to
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
